author: J.R.R. Tolkien
title: The Lord of the Rings
desc: The story is set in the fictional world of Middle-earth and follows the journey of Frodo Baggins and the Fellowship on a quest to destroy the One Ring and defeat the dark lord Sauron

author: George Orwell
desc: 1984 by George Orwell is a dystopian novel set in the year 1984 in the totalitarian state of Oceania. The story follows the protagonist, Winston Smith, who works at the Ministry of Truth and secretly rebels against the oppressive Party led by Big Brother

author: Harper Lee
title: To Kill a Mockingbird
desc: The main theme of the novel revolves around the morality of people, portraying a battle between good and evil.

author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
title: The Great Gatsby
desc: he novel revolves around Jay Gatsby, a self-made millionaire, and his pursuit of Daisy Buchanan, a wealthy young woman.

author: JK Rowling
title: Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix
desc: The story follows Harry Potter as he returns to Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry, facing challenges and mysteries while preparing for the looming threat of Lord Voldemort.

author: Markus Zusak
title: The Book Thief
desc: The story follows Liesel Meminger, a young girl who grows up in difficult times during Hitler's regime. It explores her life in her neighborhood and the lives of those around her.

author: Haruki Murakami
title: Norwegian Wood
desc: The story is narrated by Toru Watanabe, a college student reflecting on his past experiences and relationships, particularly with two women, Naoko and Midori.

author: Agatha Christie
title: Murder on the Orient Express
desc: The story begins with the discovery of the murder of an American man named Ratchett aboard the train. Renowned detective Hercule Poirot is on board and is tasked with solving the case.

author: Jane Austen
title: Pride and Prejudice
desc: he story follows the turbulent relationship between Elizabeth Bennet, the daughter of a country gentleman, and Fitzwilliam Darcy, a wealthy and proud man. It explores themes of love, class, and societal expectations.

author: Stephen King
title: The Shining
desc: The story follows Jack Torrance, his wife Wendy, and their uniquely gifted son Danny as they move into the isolated Overlook Hotel for the winter. As the family grapples with the hotel's dark past and supernatural forces, Jack's descent into madness threatens their very lives.

author: Gabriel Garcia Marquez
title: One Hundred Years of Solitude
desc: The story delves into the Buend√≠a family's history, exploring themes of love, conflict, and the cyclical nature of life in the fictional town of Macondo. It chronicles the struggles, triumphs, and tragedies that span over a century.

author: Louisa May Alcott
title: Little Women
desc: The story revolves around the March sisters, their experiences, and the challenges they face as they grow up in a New England family of modest means. It explores themes of family, love, society, and gender roles.

author: Toni Morrison
title: Beloved
desc: Set in the aftermath of the American Civil War, the novel delves into the harrowing tale of a dysfunctional family haunted by the legacy of slavery. It explores themes of trauma, memory, and the enduring impact of historical injustices.

author: Charles Dickens
title: Great Expectations
desc: The story begins with an encounter between Pip and an escaped convict in a graveyard, setting off a chain of events that shape Pip's life. As he grows up, Pip receives a large fortune from an unknown benefactor, leading him to London and high society.

author: Suzanne Collins
title: The Hunger Games
desc: The story is narrated from the perspective of 16-year-old Katniss Everdeen, who lives in a post-apocalyptic world where the government forces children to participate in a brutal televised event called the Hunger Games. The participants, known as
must fight to the death in an arena, with the sole survivor being rewarded with fame and wealth.

author: Leo Tolstoy
title: War and Peace
desc: The main focus of War and Peace is the invasion of Russia by Napoleon in 1812. The novel follows the lives of three well-known characters: Natasha Rostov, Prince Andrei Bolkonsky, and Pierre Bezukhov, as they navigate through love, war, and personal growth amidst the chaos of historical events.

author: Jojo Moyes
title: Me Before You
desc: The story follows the quirky Louisa Clark, who, after losing her job, embarks on a journey to find a new one. Along the way, she meets Will Traynor, a man whose life is drastically changed after an accident, leading to a unique and touching relationship between the two characters.
